body.name: Garmin Rino 700, Rugged 2-Way Radio and Handheld GPS Navigator with GPS/GLONASS
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 4 hrs 56 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 41 mins
features: 5 w gmrs two-way radio offers extended range, up to 20 miles; communicate by voice or unit-to-unit text Messaging.Control Method:Voice.Special Feature:Bluetooth.
High-sensitivity GPS and GLONASS satellite reception; tracks in more challenging environments than GPS alone
Position reporting feature shows locations of other Rino users on the same channel
Worldwide base map shows position and supports basic navigation
Rechargeable Internal lithium-ion battery can provide up to 13 hours of battery life. the unit’s easy-to-use thumbstick control makes one-hand operation simple
body.description: For outdoor adventurers who want to stay in touch and on track, Rino 700 is the navigator/radio combo with easy thumb stick control. Affordably priced, it retains the core functionality of the feature-rich Rino series Handhelds, and its powerful 5 W two-way radios (range up to 20 miles) is compatible with the handheld as well. Dual GPS and GLONASS satellite reception affords better tracking in challenging environments. Durable and water resistant, this Rino features a 2.2” sunlight-readable display. Its battery life can exceed 13 hours between recharges. Plus, the unique position reporting feature allows you to see the location of other Rino users on the same channel.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us We make products that are engineered on the inside for life on the outside. We do this so our customers can make the most of the time they spend pursuing their passions. Our Mission To be an enduring company by creating superior products for automotive, aviation, marine, outdoor, and sports that are an essential part of our customers’ lives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
reviews.reviewText: These work very well. I am using them in the Adirondack mountains and in very rugged terrain, with large amounts of iron deposits and the radio works well. GPS has many functions and works well also. I have only 1 small complaint. That would be, the compass does not work if your not moving. Would recommend to a friend and he now has one…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must have item.
reviews.reviewText: Outstanding! Easy to use for work and good for communicating with coworkers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great for me
reviews.reviewText: Like the smaller size and weight of the 700 over the 750's, fits very nice in the hand. The radio seems to be very good and features like texting and position sharing make it a great product. The GPS side of the unit seems to be outdated and the same software is used on much older models. Don't expect any maps. On the other hand if all you need is marking waypoints and getting you back out of the woods, which is what I wanted, then it does the job. Wish it had replaceable batteries, when your hunting off road for days there's no way to recharge unless you carry a battery pack and again that adds more weight. If this unit had a color screen and replaceable batteries it would be the perfect unit for what I use it for. If you want maps its not for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Extremely overpriced 2 way radio
reviews.reviewText: Advertised as a Rino from Garmin this device serves one purpose well, that is as a $300+ radio. All other functions have been reduced to a point of uselessness that is ridiculous for the price point. The major disappointment is the lack of uploading additional maps. Meaning your "tracks" are in the middle of a blank screen. Your "friends" are in the middle of a blank screen. You have no idea of where creeks or roads or how many hills are between you. Just saying this was a CORE function of Rino for 4 generations and this device doesn't have it. If this was priced at say $100-120 it would make some sense, even then it should not carry the Rino branding except to send your location to others with higher models that can actually do something with it. I would not recommend the Rino 700 at this price and cannot comprehend why Garmin released it in this state when it could have had the potential to be so much more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great so far
reviews.reviewText: Works great and I look forward to testing it further. I purchased to replace a Garmin Rino 300 I have had for years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I mistakenly bought the 64SX. I should have kept this one instead. I just do not have enough arms to a firearm, map, GPS and radio. Either buy an SOS device or satellite phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars hard to get lost with Garmin Rhino GPS 700
reviews.reviewText: hunting,communication & tracking my friends in the big woods in Maine & new hampshire & VT

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Non-replaceable battery failed after a few months.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Garmin 700 in February 2020 and was very happy with its performance. Now 5 month later, and after only a handful of uses, the battery has completely failed. The unit operates as normal only when plugged into a power source, but will not charge, effectively crippling its usefulness.***Update Garmin Support was very helpful and offered to replace the unit (still under warranty). I still would never have purchased this item had I realized that the battery is non-replaceable.***
